article_title: If any state needs to expand Medicaid, it’s Kansas
article_text:
00:56 State Rep. John Rubin on juvenile justice Pause

08:10 Don Munday recaps 2015 in rhyme and verse

02:36 A medical game changer

01:49 "The politics of poverty are poisonous"

01:08 Kansas City Star editorial on ADA improvements

02:44 Ferguson now and then

00:57 Bri Villanueva, Eddie Chagoya throw in slow mo

01:00 Street car hit by car

00:17 Royals versus White Sox game postponed

01:57 Black faculty still scarce at University of Missouri

article_metadata.description: If any state should be looking at Medicaid expansion, it is cash-strapped, economically stagnant Kansas, where one rural hospital recently closed and others are struggling.
article_metadata.title: If any state needs to expand Medicaid, it’s Kansas | The Kansas City Star
